title.narrative: Nepal Health Sector Management Reform Program

description.narrative: The Program Development Objective is to improve efficiency in the Federal-level public resource management systems of the health sector in Nepal.

title.narrative: Health facilities reporting annual disaggregated data using District Health Information System (DHIS 2) in a timely manner. (DLI 10)

target.value: DLR 10.6 HMIS/DHIS 2 shows timely reporting from at least 70% of public health facilities in Year 6

actual.value: HMIS/DHIS 2 shows timely reporting from at least 68.71% of public health facilities in Year 5

title.narrative: Percentage of the MoHP’s annual spending captured by the TABUCS/CGAS. (DLI 8)

target.value: DLR 8.6: 95% of MoHP spending in Year 6 captured by TABUCS/CGAS

actual.value: 97.96% of MoHP spending in Year 4 captured by TABUCS

title.narrative: Percentage improvement in EVM score over 2014 baseline. (DLI 6)

baseline.value: Average EVM Score of 64%, with two attributes achieving 80%

target.value: DLR 6.2a Average EVM Score of 70% (based on a survey conducted in 2019 or later) DLR 6.2b Any four (4) attributes in EVM Scoreachieving at least 80%

actual.value: Average EVM Score of 82%, with six attributes achieving 80%

title.narrative: Percentage of contracts managed by the MD through the PPMO’s online procurement portal (DLI 1)

baseline.value: No contract is through online e-procurement developed by the Public Procurement Management Office (PPMO)

target.value: DLR 1.7: 95% of value of total contracts managed by MD done through online e-procurement of Year 6

actual.value: 99.14% of value of total contracts managed by MD done through online e-procurement of Year 5

title.narrative: MoHP to provide guidance and support to the subnational governments on citizen engagement mechanism (DLI 11)

baseline.value: No formal guidelines for citizen feedback mechanisms in place for Provinces and/or Local Governments

target.value: DLR 11.6: MoHP provided on-site support to at least three (3) Local Governments each in at least four Provinces in conductingsocial audits

actual.value: MoHP has provided orientation to all provinces on new social accountability framework

title.narrative: Percentage of the MoHP spending entities submitting annual plan and budget using eAWPB. (DLI 7)

baseline.value: Not all spending units submit their annual plan and budget using eAWPB

target.value: DLR 7.6a eAWPB used in Year 6 for planning and budget submission by MoHP and all its departments, divisions and centers DLR 7.6beAWPB used in Year 6 for and 95% of remaining spending units (excluding units included under DLR 7.6a) under MoHP

actual.value: eAWPB has been used in Year 5 for planning and budget submission by the MoHP and its all departments, divisions, centers andspending units.

title.narrative: Percentage of procurements done by Management Division (MD) using standard specifications (DLI 3)

baseline.value: Procurement not based on standard specifications

target.value: DLR 3.7a For Year 6 procurement, 95% of health commodities procured by MD, is based on the use of standard specificationsDLR 3.7bFor Year 6 procurement, 80% of equipment procured by MD is based on the use of standard specifications

actual.value: 100% of MD awarded contract value for Health Commodities and Health Equipment is based on the use of standard specification. Thespecification available at MD website matches with the standard specification mentioned in the bidding document.

title.narrative: Establishment and functioning of web-based grievance redressal mechanism (DLI 2)

baseline.value: Web-based Grievance Redressal Mechanism not established

target.value: DLR 2.6: MoHP has made available on its website an annual report on the status of grievances received in Year 6

actual.value: MOHP has made available an annual report on the website of Management Division providing status of grievances registered

title.narrative: Central medical stores and medical stores of Provinces report through eLMIS (DLI 4)

target.value: DLR 4.5: eLMIS information for program Year 6 is available from central and provincial (including sub-provincial) stores ofProvinces.

actual.value: The eLMIS information for program Year 5 is available from central and all the provincial (including sub-provincial) stores ofProvince

title.narrative: Percentage of audited spending units responding to the OAG’s primary audit queries within 35 days. (DLI 9)

baseline.value: Percentage as derived from MoHP inventory of responses in Year 1

target.value: DLR 9.6 80% of spending units reporting to the MoHP respond to primary audit queries within mandated 35 days

actual.value: 91.6% of the cost centers responded to the OAG’s audit queries within 35 days.

title.narrative: Percentage reduction of less than minimum stocks (understock) of tracer health commodities in sub-provincial medical stores (DLI 5)

baseline.value: Baseline to be established in Year 3

target.value: DLR 5.3: 35% reduction in understock of tracer health commodities in Year 6 over the baseline established for the sub-provincial(district) stores through the eLMIS for two Provinces.

actual.value: 58.94% reduction in understock of tracer health commodities in Year 5 over the baseline established for the sub-provincial(district) stores through the eLMIS for two Provinces of Lumbini and Karnali
